summary: fibroblasts are present in all tissues but predominantly in connective tissues. their origin is mesenchymal, and, depending on their localization, they have multiple morphologies. they may be flattened, elongated or of a certain spindle-shape. fibroblasts should be considered sentinels against microorganisms or microbial components. innate immune system is first line of response to pathogens. recognition of pathogens is mediated by TLRs, which recognize specific pathogens associated molecular patterns. the flagellin of gram-negative bacteria can be recognized by TLR5 and TLR7.
